scenes.text_segment: Title: Full Text; VOICES OF THE PAST.  Jetsun paced down the hallway, trying to stay ahead of the screams. The high ceilings of the Western Air Temple tended to make echoes of whispers and explosions of dropped teacups. Though the girl was back in the infirmary being watched by the elders, her cries of pain sprang from every surface, bouncing off the hard stone. Jetsun couldn’t take it anymore and broke into a full run. Ignoring decorum, she sped past her sisters, ruffling robes, upsetting inkpots, prematurely ruining colorful sand paintings that were meant to be ruined only once they were finished.

global_context.scene_description: The scene is set in the austere, ancient corridors of the Western Air Temple during dawn, where the early light begins to infiltrate the space. The architecture is grand, with high ceilings and long, echoing hallways made of stone, adorned sporadically with vibrant sand paintings and relics of spiritual significance. The atmosphere is charged with a mix of serenity outside and turmoil within, as Jetsun moves through this hallowed space.

objects.label: Jetsun

visual_attributes.clothing: Traditional Air Nomad robes

micro_details: Hair tousled by the rush
Bare feet barely touching the cold stone floor
Fingers slightly curled as if bracing for impact

semantic_relationships: Jetsun casts shadow on the stone floor

audio_cues.description: The soft yet sharp echo of Jetsun's bare feet against the stone floor

scenes.text_segment: No one scolded her or gave her sharp looks in passing. They understood. When she ran out of floor, she jumped. The upside-down construction of the temple meant that despite its overall size, there was very little space to stand on, nothing connecting the spires but thin air and a three-thousandfoot drop. She didn’t have her glider. Eminently dangerous, but she could make the leap without it. Air at her back and air against her robes gave her enough loft to land on the next tower, the one containing the Great Library.

global_context.scene_description: This scene unfolds at the precipice of an ancient, upside-down temple suspended in the sky at dawn. The sky is painted with the soft hues of early morning, casting everything in a serene yet eerie glow. The temple's architecture, a marvel of gravity-defying construction, features towers and spires that jut downwards towards the earth, connected by barely visible bridges. The atmosphere is clear, with a few wisps of clouds below, emphasizing the temple's height. The lighting is primarily natural sunlight with a soft, diffused quality, coming from the horizon and giving the scene a warm, golden hue.

audio_cues.description: The sound of wind accentuates the height and danger of the leap

scenes.text_segment: Tsering, chief caretaker of the books, waited in front of the tall shelves. The older woman’s kind eyes were edged with worry. “I saw you coming. Is it happening again?” Jetsun nodded. “Mesose,” she said. Tsering blew out a breath, a silent whistle of frustration. “That could be Mesose, famous scholar of the Ru Ming era. There’s a Mesose village in Hu Xin; it might have been named after a founder. Or it could just be someone called Mesose, in which case we’re stuck.” Avatars tended to run in exalted circles. Or they elevated the people around them to fame.

global_context.scene_description: A dimly lit, vast library filled with towering shelves of ancient books and scrolls. The air is heavy with the scent of aged paper and wood. It's early morning, and the first rays of sunlight filter through large, dust-speckled windows, creating a serene yet mysterious atmosphere. The library is silent except for the soft, echoing footsteps of its two inhabitants.

visual_attributes.clothing: A traditional, floor-length robe embroidered with intricate designs

micro_details: A silver hairpin loosely holding her hair
Deep creases around her eyes, showing age and concern
A worn leather bracelet on her wrist
Faint ink stains on her fingers
A delicate, yet authoritative posture

visual_attributes.clothing: A simple, utilitarian outfit suited for travel

micro_details: A small, intricately carved amulet hangs around her neck
A map peeks out from one of her pockets
Her boots are scuffed and dusty from the road
Her hair is pulled back in a practical bun
Carries a sense of urgency in her stance

semantic_relationships: Tsering's shadow casts onto the bookshelves

audio_cues.description: The subtle sound of pages being turned and a distant echo of footsteps on the wooden floor.

scenes.text_segment: “It has to be the first one,” Jetsun said. Another wail turned both their heads. The child was suffering. “Help me and it’ll go faster,” Tsering said. “Northwest corner, start with the poetry shelves, Ru with the three drops of water radical.” They split up to search different sections of the ancient vault. Jetsun ran her eyes over labels and titles as fast as she could. Not every book fit on a shelf. Many of the tomes kept at the Western Temple were so old they were written on bamboo slips instead of paper.

global_context.scene_description: In a dimly lit, extensive vault filled with the ancient knowledge of the Western Temple, Jetsun and Tsering are searching frantically for a specific tome. The air is thick with dust particles, floating lazily in beams of light that manage to seep in through the small windows near the vault's ceiling. The shelves, carved from dark, aged wood, are crammed with books, scrolls, and bamboo slips, some of which spill onto the floor, creating an impression of organized chaos. The feeling of urgency is palpable as the child's distant wails echo through the stone corridors, emphasizing the gravity of their quest.

audio_cues.description: A haunting, distant wail echoes through the stone walls, adding a layer of urgency and distress to the scene.

scenes.text_segment: She passed rolled bales of text wider around than some of the pillars connecting the ceilings to the floors. Five minutes later she emerged from the library’s depths, clutching a treatise on she didn’t know exactly what. What mattered was the author’s name. Tsering met her by the door. “I couldn’t find any leads. You’re holding our best shot.” “Thank you.” Jetsun sprinted back in the direction she came, the book tucked under her arm. “Use your glider next time!” Tsering yelled. Jetsun burst back into the infirmary. The huddle of elders parted to let her through.

global_context.scene_description: The scene unfolds in a vast, ancient library, transitioning to a dimly lit infirmary. The library is filled with towering bales of texts and enormous pillars that stretch from the floor to the high ceiling, creating a labyrinthine network of knowledge. As dawn breaks, the first rays of sunlight filter through the high windows, casting long, dramatic shadows across the stone floor. The weather outside is serene, contributing to a tranquil yet suspenseful atmosphere inside. The lighting transitions from soft, natural sunlight in the library to mixed, softer artificial light in the infirmary.

audio_cues.description: Jetsun's rapid footsteps echo through the library and infirmary halls.

scenes.text_segment: The girl’s thrashing had settled into dry, cavernous sobs. She pounded her fist on her pillow over and over, not the involuntary shaking of a fever but rather the deliberate motion born of a steady, all-consuming anguish that should have been beyond her eight years. “We’ll leave you two alone,” Abbess Dagmola said. She and the rest of the nuns filed out. Too many people sometimes ruined the effect. Jetsun opened the book to a random page and began to read.

global_context.scene_description: The room is sparsely furnished, walls adorned with faded tapestries depicting scenes of pastoral tranquility. A narrow bed sits against one wall, its linens disheveled from the girl's earlier tumult. The first light of dawn filters through a small window, casting the room in a soft, ethereal glow. The air is still, heavy with the residue of the girl's grief. Abbess Dagmola, a figure of composed authority, gestures silently, leading the departure of the nuns, their movements a quiet symphony of rustling fabrics and subdued footsteps. In the newly forged solitude, Jetsun, seated beside the bed, opens an ancient, leather-bound book.

The soft sound of a page turning as Jetsun begins to read.

scenes.text_segment: “ ‘The level of risk can be determined by elevation, nearness to the source of water, vulnerability to rapid flows, and potential economic damage,’ ” she said. Confused, she briefly turned the volume to look at the cover. A Discourse on Floodplain Management. Why in the world do we have this book? Jetsun shook her head. It didn’t matter. “ ‘Understanding previous measures taken to mitigate the damage from flooding is essential, for they might compile danger instead of reducing it.’ ” The girl took a shuddering gasp of air and relaxed.

global_context.scene_description: In a dimly lit, cluttered study filled with books and papers strewn across a large oak desk, Jetsun sits in a heavy, leather-bound chair. The room is packed with shelves of books, a large window behind the desk shows the early light of dawn creeping in, casting long shadows across the wooden floor. The atmosphere is thick with the musky scent of old paper and the lingering aroma of extinguished candles.

semantic_relationships: Natural sunlight casts long shadows across the room

scenes.text_segment: “Half a year and that’s as far as you’ve gotten?” she said, smiling at no one. “You have to stop taking on so many projects at once, Se-Se.” It worked. Thank the spirits, it worked. Jetsun kept reading, plowing through the unfamiliar concepts mechanically. “ ‘On the subject of silt deposits . . .’ ” The first time the child went through this, they had no clue as to what was happening. The healers did their best to cool her fever and keep her as comfortable as they could.

global_context.scene_description: In a dimly lit, spacious room resembling a blend of a traditional study and an apothecary, Jetsun, a young child, sits at a large wooden desk cluttered with scrolls, books, and various ancient artifacts. The room is filled with shelves that reach the ceiling, crammed with books and herbs. The morning light filters softly through a large window, casting a serene glow over the room. The weather outside is clear, indicating it's a peaceful morning. The indoor lighting is supplemented with candlelight, adding a warm ambiance to the room.

audio_cues.description: A gentle breeze can be heard rustling the leaves outside, complementing the serene atmosphere of the room.

scenes.text_segment: As the incidents reoccurred, her babbling, incoherent at first, started to coalesce into sentences, names, slices of conversations. The words meant nothing to her caregivers until one day they heard her talking to His Majesty the Earth King Zhoulai. A man she’d never met, who’d died three centuries ago. Thankfully, the abbess had thought to take notes. She’d written down every intelligible scrap, and in scouring her pages she pieced together a pattern. The names. Angilirq, Praew, Yotogawa. Names from every nation. Names of past Avatar companions.

global_context.scene_description: In a dimly lit, ancient library filled with towering bookshelves and scattered manuscripts, a young woman sits at a heavy wooden table, her eyes closed as if in deep meditation. The early morning light filters in through large, stained glass windows, casting colorful patterns on the stone floor. Dust particles dance in the air, illuminated by the rays of the rising sun. The atmosphere is serene yet charged with a mystical energy.

audio_cues.description: signifying the early hour of the day

scenes.text_segment: Not every phantom the child spoke to had made it into the annals of history, and some that had were never acknowledged as having close ties to an Avatar. Jetsun could only imagine the stories lost to time, filtering through the girl, merest fragments sticking in her throat. And the conversations were pleasant, frequently enough. She would laugh with her friends in towns that had been renamed, provinces that no longer existed. Jetsun had watched her leap from her bed and bellow at the success of legendary winter hunts, sit on the floor and meditate with someone else’s inner peace.

global_context.scene_description: The room is dimly lit, illuminated by the first light of dawn peeking through a small window. The walls are adorned with ancient tapestries, depicting scenes of old, forgotten battles and serene landscapes of provinces no longer recognized. A small, unmade bed sits in one corner, while various artifacts and scrolls are scattered throughout the room, suggesting a deep, historical research or connection. Jetsun stands in the doorway, observing the child, who is centered in the frame, engaged in different activities that bridge the gap between the physical and the spiritual world.

audio_cues.description: The gentle chirping of birds outside, suggesting a peaceful morning

scenes.text_segment: But occasionally she would have waking nightmares. Bouts of sorrow and rage that threatened to tear her apart. She wouldn’t mutter names but scream them as if she’d been betrayed by the universe itself. By accident, they discovered she could sometimes be calmed by figuring out the past figure she was talking to, when it was possible, and speaking back to her from that perspective. The deeper they could dive into the role the better, like parents reading a bedtime story, doing voices and parts. Familiarity was the best balm they had, and they acted their hearts out for her.

global_context.scene_description: The scene unfolds in a sparsely furnished, dimly lit room during the twilight hours of dawn. The atmosphere is thick with a palpable mix of tension and anticipation. The weather outside contributes to the scene's moodiness, with a serene but eerily quiet ambiance, as if the world itself is holding its breath. Inside, the only source of light is the soft, diffused natural sunlight seeping through a half-open window, casting long shadows and highlighting the expressions of intense emotion on the characters' faces.

audio_cues.description: The serene yet eerie chirping of birds at dawn sets a contrasting backdrop to the tense scene inside.
The murmurs and whispers of the characters trying to calm the tormented character, barely breaking the tense silence.

scenes.text_segment: The girl nodded off by the time Jetsun reached a chapter on the proper construction of seawalls. Tsering entered the room. No glider, Jetsun noticed. She probably wanted to see if she could still make the jump too. “How is she?” the librarian asked. “Better,” Jetsun said. “Who was Mesose?” “A companion of Avatar Gun,” Tsering said, coming over to the bedside. “Skilled poet and engineer, who died in Ha’an when Gun failed to hold back a tsunami.” Jetsun found a sour taste rising in her mouth.

global_context.scene_description: The scene unfolds in a dimly lit, spacious library room adorned with ancient scrolls and books, where the ambient glow of dawn seeps through large, ornate windows. The air feels heavy with knowledge and the silent weight of history. Jetsun, an aged librarian with wisdom etched into her features, is seated beside a small bed where a young girl lies sleeping, the room imbued with a sense of tranquility and the lingering promise of adventure.

scenes.text_segment: “Failed?” Not the choice of words she would have used for someone, Avatar or not, bravely confronting a force of nature. Ha’an still stood today as a port when it sounded like it could have been wiped off the map along with everyone who’d lived there at the time. “It’s what’s written. After Mesose drowned, Gun disappeared for quite a while before returning to duty.” You were grieving.

global_context.scene_description: This scene unfolds in a dimly lit, spacious room filled with ancient artifacts and maps detailing various mythical locations. The atmosphere is heavy with the weight of history and the solemnity of the conversation. Two characters stand facing each other, the tension between them palpable. The room is lit by the early rays of dawn filtering through a large window, casting long shadows and highlighting the dust motes dancing in the air.

audio_cues.description: A soft, almost inaudible hum of the early morning outside, mingled with the faint rustling of pages as the characters speak.

scenes.text_segment: If the waters that Gun fought were the same ones that killed Mesose, then both the girl and the past life raging through her might have personally witnessed their friend take their last breath before plunging below the waves. They would have searched for a body in the wreckage. And worst of all, Jetsun thought, they would have had to struggle with the terrible question of what if I’d done things differently? What if, what if, what if? Perhaps Gun was the one who’d demanded the label of failure. It was simply unjust. To remember the events of a single life was painful enough.

global_context.scene_description: This scene is a poignant, emotionally charged moment where Jetsun reflects on Gun's internal turmoil and the painful memories of losing Mesose at sea. It captures the essence of mourning and introspection, set against the backdrop of a tumultuous sea at dawn, symbolizing a new beginning yet carrying the weight of the past.

scenes.text_segment: Reliving dozens of lives would be . . . well, it would be like getting caught by a tsunami. Swept away by forces beyond your control. “She’s a smart kid,” Jetsun said. “If she keeps having these visions, she’ll figure out who she is long before she turns sixteen.” Tsering sighed. She reached out and stroked the sleeping girl’s hair, now matted with sweat. “Oh, little Yangchen,” she said. “What are we going to do with you?”

global_context.scene_description: An ancient, dimly lit chamber, with walls adorned with faded tapestries and relics of past lives scattered around. The early rays of dawn filter through a small aperture, casting a serene yet eerie glow over the scene. Tsering and Jetsun are seated on the floor, their attention focused on the sleeping girl, Yangchen, who lies on a simple, aged bed. The air is thick with anticipation and the weight of unspoken worries.
